channel.title: Usb hub support in new firmware (not released)
channel.description:
hi there,
a question popped up regarding usb-hub support. will it be possible to interconnect two usb-midi devices? so for example plug in an usb-midi keyboard and a synth with usb-midi and send data from the keyboard to the synth. what would the latency be like?
thanks

item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

Check the Post by @logsol in this thread https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/raspberry-pi-as-hub-for-usb-midi-devices-advice/3110/2

Read full topic

item.title: Usb hub support in new firmware (not released)
item.dc:creator: @kr0n Victor
item.description:
@kr0n wrote:

Thanks for the reply! So itâ€™s a matter of the Axoloti not knowing what MIDI messages are meant for it? Hence the need for some routing?

What about using a RaspPi to provide that routing? Would that work or has someone tried that?

Read full topic
item.source: Usb hub support in new firmware (not released)

item.title: Usb hub support in new firmware (not released)
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

No they are not supported. There have not been any updated in a very, very long time.

There are experimental versions on github, but you have to build them yourself. And from what I understand they are buggy.

If you want to use more midi devices, you can just connect them to a computer and then use this program to route the midi to axoloti:
http://notahat.com/midi_patchbay/

Read full topic

item.title: Usb hub support in new firmware (not released)
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

ok, thanks @thetechnobear! my question regarding latency was geared towards interconnecting devices. will there be additional processing latency from usb to usb? (something like 1.3ms as for audio) or is this handled on a lower level? anyways, exciting stuff!!

Read full topic
item.source: Usb hub support in new firmware (not released)

item.title: Usb hub support in new firmware (not released)
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

new firmware will have hub support, code is already in dev version.
yes you can send data between devices , there is also a new way of identifying devices in patches.
Latency is fine as far as I can tell, I donâ€™t think any more than if you plugged in directly really.

Read full topic
